text.section: There is a Joint Committee on the Port of Baltimore.

section.section:
Of the 15 members:
10 shall be appointed jointly by the President of the Senate and the Speaker of the House as follows:
1 shall be a representative of the United States Coast Guard, to be appointed by the Captain of the Port, United States Coast Guard, Baltimore.

text.section: The members of the Committee serve at the pleasure of the presiding officer who appointed them.
The President and the Speaker shall jointly appoint a Senator and a Delegate each to serve as cochairman.

section.section: The Committee shall examine and evaluate issues affecting the competitive position of the Port of Baltimore within the international port industry.
This examination shall include the regulations adopted by the State Board of Pilots, the State Board of Docking Masters, and the Maryland Port Commission.

text.section:
The Secretary of the Department of Labor, Licensing, and Regulation, the Secretary of the Department of Transportation, and the Executive Director of the Maryland Port Administration shall:
cooperate fully with the Committee; and
keep the Committee fully informed as to issues affecting the Port of Baltimore.
The Committee shall report to the Governor and the Legislative Policy Committee on or before December 31 of each year.
